title: Laura's Quick Slow Cooker Turkey Chili Recipe
description: This is an easy crockpot turkey chili recipe you can throw in the slow cooker and forget about until dinner. Zesty flavor meets convenience here.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Chili Recipes Turkey Chili Recipes Laura's Quick Slow Cooker Turkey Chili 4.7 (1,673) 1,155 Reviews 104 Photos This is an easy crockpot turkey chili recipe that you can quickly throw together in the slow cooker and forget about all day. Great topped with Cheddar cheese, crushed corn chips, and a dollop of sour cream. Submitted by LauraKKH Updated on November 13, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 104 104 104 104 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 4 hrs Total Time: 4 hrs 15 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1 pound ground turkey cooking spray 2 (10.75 ounce) cans low sodium tomato soup 2 (15 ounce) cans kidney beans, drained 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained ½ medium onion, chopped 2 tablespoons chili powder ½ tablespoon garlic powder ½ tablespoon ground cumin 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes 1 pinch ground black pepper 1 pinch ground allspice salt to taste Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Place turkey in the skillet, and cook until evenly brown; drain. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Coat the inside of a slow cooker with cooking spray, and mix in turkey, tomato soup, kidney beans, black beans, and onion. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Season with chili powder, garlic powder, cumin, red pepper flakes, black pepper, allspice, and salt. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cover, and cook on Low for 8 hours, or on High for 4 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 3,091 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 276 Calories 8g Fat 33g Carbs 21g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 276 % Daily Value * Total Fat 8g 10% Saturated Fat 2g 8% Cholesterol 42mg 14% Sodium 547mg 24% Total Carbohydrate 33g 12% Dietary Fiber 11g 40% Total Sugars 1g Protein 21g 42% Vitamin C 24mg 27% Calcium 78mg 6% Iron 4mg 24% Potassium 428mg 9% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Laura's Quick Slow Cooker Turkey Chili 01 of 104 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 104 Photo by  ToughBran9764 02/18/2023 Great recipe, this was the first recipe I have tried on allrecipes and it did not disappoint. I used Italian ground turkey for a little extra flavor. The chili tired out just a little on the spicy side but in my case that is a good thing 03 of 104 Photo by  Jim 10/30/2022 Very good 04 of 104 Photo by  Cheryl Peterson 10/13/2022 Excellent best ever chili!! I add corn sweet potatoes and butternut squash to mine. So healthy and good fiber. I also added acup of chicken broth 05 of 104 Photo by  Food4Thought 11/08/2021 Copied this recipe to a T. Hearty dish, didn't find it spicy at all but was delicious. I would make this again. 06 of 104 Photo by  Tarenthia Pollard 02/01/2021 07 of 104 Photo by  Scott Crouch 12/09/2020 This is a very simple and delicious recipe to make. I've made it with turkey, beef, bison, and venison and it turned out great every time. I think the next time I'm going to try elk. I wouldn't be a proper reviewer if I didn't make some changes to fit my own taste. lol I like a chunky, hearty chili. So this is what I changed, instead of 1 lb of meat. I use 1.5 lb and that works out better for me. Instead of the tomato soup, I use one 28-oz can of Red Gold whole peeled tomatoes. I dump them in and then I use my wooden spoon to crush them against the side of the pot. Some may choose to add some water, but I don't. Other than that, I keep everything the same. *Pro tip: If your chili comes out too soupy. Use a potato masher to crush up some of the beans, but not all. This will thicken up your chili pretty good. Enjoy 08 of 104 Photo by  Mark Hudson 05/21/2020 09 of 104 Photo by  Mark Hudson 05/21/2020 10 of 104 Photo by  Alexandra Parent 04/20/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Spicy Turkey Chili 69 Ratings Fantastic Black Bean Chili 1,055 Ratings Slow Cooker Turkey Chili with Kidney Beans 3 Ratings Chicken and Corn Chili 789 Ratings Grandma's Slow Cooker Vegetarian Chili 982 Ratings Simple Turkey Chili 2,362 Ratings Slow Cook 3-Bean Chili (Vegetarian and Gluten Free) 12 Ratings Black Bean Chili 364 Ratings Elk Chili 101 Ratings White Bean Chicken Chili 1,317 Ratings Turkey-Lentil Chili 109 Ratings Vegetarian Chili 286 Ratings Vegetarian Black Bean Chili 12 Ratings Incredibly Easy Vegetarian Chili 717 Ratings Portobello Mushroom Chili 33 Ratings Michelle's Blonde Chicken Chili 295 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
